messages.title: ANNE-MARIE DEFENDS RURAL VILLAGES
messages.content: Anne-Marie is fighting to stop hundreds of giant industrial turbines scarring rural Northumberland. The Chairman of ‘Wingates not Windfarms’ asked Anne-Marie for her help when developers threatened to surround the village with 35 turbines.

messages.title: ANNE-MARIE GETS SEAHOUSES HARBOUR WALL REBUILD
messages.content: Anne-Marie got £750,000 from DEFRA to rebuild Seahouses harbour wall. The Harbour Master asked for her support when no one else would help. She is now working to secure a second grant to safeguard the Harbour's future.

messages.title: NEW HOSPITAL FOR BERWICK
messages.content: Anne-Marie's campaign for a new Berwick hospital has succeeded. The new Berwick Infirmary will begin construction in 2013. Anne-Marie is an elected Governor of Northumbria NHS Trust. She believes in the importance of giving responsibility back to our doctors and nurses.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Active opposition to the construction of wind turbines that negatively impact rural villages and their surroundings.
Securing funding for critical infrastructure such as harbour walls, with further efforts to acquire additional grants to protect local community assets.
Successful campaigning for a new hospital and emphasis on the need for local control and responsibility in healthcare.

issues.environment: Opposition to the installation of wind turbines in rural areas.
issues.health: Support for the construction of a new hospital and involvement in the local NHS Trust, advocating for local control and responsibility in healthcare.

politicalExperience.achievements: Instrumental in campaigning for a new Berwick hospital. Emphasizes the need for local responsibility in healthcare.
